#!/usr/bin/env zsh
# Utility functions for development environment manager

# Color output functions
function print_info() {
    print -P "%F{blue}‚Ñπ%f  $*"
}

function print_success() {
    print -P "%F{green}‚úì%f  $*"
}

function print_error() {
    print -P "%F{red}‚úó%f  $*" >&2
}

function print_warning() {
    print -P "%F{yellow}‚ö†%f  $*"
}

# Check if command exists
function command_exists() {
    command -v "$1" &>/dev/null
}

# Create directory if it doesn't exist
function ensure_dir() {
    local dir="$1"
    if [[ ! -d "$dir" ]]; then
        mkdir -p "$dir" && print_success "Created directory: $dir"
    fi
}

# Safe source - only source if file exists
function safe_source() {
    local file="$1"
    [[ -f "$file" ]] && source "$file"
}

# Get project root (looks for .git, package.json, etc)
function get_project_root() {
    local dir="$PWD"
    while [[ "$dir" != "/" ]]; do
        if [[ -d "$dir/.git" ]] || [[ -f "$dir/package.json" ]] || [[ -f "$dir/Gemfile" ]]; then
            echo "$dir"
            return 0
        fi
        dir="${dir:h}"
    done
    return 1
}

# Parse JSON with fallback
function parse_json() {
    local json="$1"
    local key="$2"
    
    if command_exists jq; then
        echo "$json" | jq -r ".$key // empty"
    elif command_exists python3; then
        python3 -c "import json; d=json.loads('$json'); print(d.get('$key', ''))"
    else
        print_warning "No JSON parser available (install jq or python3)"
        return 1
    fi
}

# Enhanced array operations
function array_contains() {
    local needle="$1"
    shift
    local haystack=("$@")
    
    (( ${haystack[(I)$needle]} ))
}

# Format duration in human-readable form
function format_duration() {
    local seconds="$1"
    local hours=$((seconds / 3600))
    local minutes=$(((seconds % 3600) / 60))
    local secs=$((seconds % 60))
    
    if (( hours > 0 )); then
        printf "%dh %dm %ds" $hours $minutes $secs
    elif (( minutes > 0 )); then
        printf "%dm %ds" $minutes $secs
    else
        printf "%ds" $secs
    fi
}

# Get file size in human-readable format
function human_size() {
    local size="$1"
    local units=(B KB MB GB TB)
    local unit=0
    
    while (( size > 1024 && unit < ${#units[@]} - 1 )); do
        size=$((size / 1024.0))
        ((unit++))
    done
    
    printf "%.1f%s" $size ${units[unit+1]}
}

print_success "Functions library loaded"

#!/usr/bin/env zsh
# Command completions for development environment manager

# Define environment types
local -a env_types
env_types=(node python ruby go rust docker)

# Define common commands
local -a dev_commands
dev_commands=(init start stop status clean update logs shell)

# Main completion function
function _devenv() {
    local context state line
    typeset -A opt_args
    
    _arguments -C \
        '1:command:->command' \
        '2:subcommand:->subcommand' \
        '*::arg:->args' \
        '-h[Show help]' \
        '--help[Show help]' \
        '-v[Verbose output]' \
        '--verbose[Verbose output]' \
        '-f[Force operation]' \
        '--force[Force operation]'
    
    case $state in
        command)
            _describe 'command' dev_commands
            ;;
        subcommand)
            case ${line[1]} in
                init)
                    _describe 'environment type' env_types
                    ;;
                start|stop)
                    _devenv_services
                    ;;
                logs)
                    _devenv_services
                    ;;
                update)
                    local -a update_targets
                    update_targets=(all deps tools)
                    _describe 'update target' update_targets
                    ;;
            esac
            ;;
        args)
            case ${line[1]} in
                shell)
                    _devenv_containers
                    ;;
                logs)
                    if [[ ${#line[@]} -eq 2 ]]; then
                        _arguments \
                            '-f[Follow log output]' \
                            '--follow[Follow log output]' \
                            '-n[Number of lines]:lines:' \
                            '--tail[Number of lines]:lines:'
                    fi
                    ;;
            esac
            ;;
    esac
}

# Complete service names
function _devenv_services() {
    local -a services
    services=()
    
    # Check docker-compose.yml if it exists
    if [[ -f docker-compose.yml ]]; then
        if command -v yq &>/dev/null; then
            services=(${(f)"$(yq eval '.services | keys | .[]' docker-compose.yml 2>/dev/null)"})
        elif command -v docker &>/dev/null; then
            services=(${(f)"$(docker compose config --services 2>/dev/null)"})
        fi
    fi
    
    # Add common service names as fallback
    if (( ${#services} == 0 )); then
        services=(web db redis cache queue worker)
    fi
    
    _describe 'service' services
}

# Complete container names
function _devenv_containers() {
    local -a containers
    
    if command -v docker &>/dev/null; then
        containers=(${(f)"$(docker ps --format '{{.Names}}' 2>/dev/null)"})
    fi
    
    if (( ${#containers} > 0 )); then
        _describe 'container' containers
    else
        _message 'no running containers found'
    fi
}

# Git branch completion for certain commands
function _devenv_git_branches() {
    local -a branches
    branches=(${(f)"$(git branch --format='%(refname:short)' 2>/dev/null)"})
    
    if (( ${#branches} > 0 )); then
        _describe 'branch' branches
    fi
}

# File completion with filtering
function _devenv_project_files() {
    local -a extensions
    case "$1" in
        node)
            extensions=(js jsx ts tsx json)
            ;;
        python)
            extensions=(py pyw pyc pyo)
            ;;
        ruby)
            extensions=(rb rake gemspec)
            ;;
        *)
            extensions=()
            ;;
    esac
    
    if (( ${#extensions} > 0 )); then
        local pattern="**/*.(${(j:|:)extensions})"
        _files -g "$pattern"
    else
        _files
    fi
}

# Register the completion
compdef _devenv devenv

print_success "Completions loaded (use 'devenv <TAB>' to test)"

#!/usr/bin/env zsh
# Git helper functions for development environment

# Source utilities if not already loaded
[[ -f "${0:A:h}/../lib/functions.zsh" ]] && source "${0:A:h}/../lib/functions.zsh"

# Git status with better formatting
function git_status() {
    if ! git rev-parse --git-dir &>/dev/null; then
        print_error "Not in a git repository"
        return 1
    fi
    
    local branch=$(git branch --show-current 2>/dev/null)
    local ahead_behind=$(git rev-list --left-right --count HEAD...@{u} 2>/dev/null)
    local ahead=${ahead_behind%$'\t'*}
    local behind=${ahead_behind#*$'\t'}
    
    print_info "Current branch: %F{cyan}$branch%f"
    
    if [[ -n "$ahead_behind" ]]; then
        [[ $ahead -gt 0 ]] && print -P "  %F{green}‚Üë$ahead%f ahead"
        [[ $behind -gt 0 ]] && print -P "  %F{red}‚Üì$behind%f behind"
    fi
    
    # Show file status
    local -A status_counts
    while IFS= read -r line; do
        local status=${line[1,2]}
        case $status in
            "??")
                ((status_counts[untracked]++))
                ;;
            "M ")
                ((status_counts[modified]++))
                ;;
            "A ")
                ((status_counts[added]++))
                ;;
            "D ")
                ((status_counts[deleted]++))
                ;;
            " M")
                ((status_counts[unstaged]++))
                ;;
        esac
    done < <(git status --porcelain 2>/dev/null)
    
    # Display counts
    for key val in ${(kv)status_counts}; do
        case $key in
            untracked)
                print_warning "$val untracked files"
                ;;
            modified)
                print_info "$val modified files"
                ;;
            added)
                print_success "$val added files"
                ;;
            deleted)
                print_error "$val deleted files"
                ;;
            unstaged)
                print_warning "$val unstaged changes"
                ;;
        esac
    done
}

# Interactive git branch switcher
function git_switch() {
    if ! command_exists fzf; then
        print_error "fzf not found. Install it for interactive branch switching"
        return 1
    fi
    
    local branch=$(git branch --all | \
        grep -v HEAD | \
        sed 's/.* //' | \
        sed 's#remotes/[^/]*/##' | \
        sort -u | \
        fzf --height=20% --reverse --info=inline)
    
    if [[ -n "$branch" ]]; then
        git checkout "$branch"
    fi
}

# Create feature branch with naming convention
function git_feature() {
    local feature_name="$1"
    local prefix="${2:-feature}"
    
    if [[ -z "$feature_name" ]]; then
        print_error "Usage: git_feature <name> [prefix]"
        return 1
    fi
    
    local branch_name="$prefix/$(date +%Y%m%d)-$feature_name"
    
    print_info "Creating branch: $branch_name"
    git checkout -b "$branch_name"
}

# Git commit with conventional commits
function git_commit() {
    local -A commit_types
    commit_types=(
        feat "A new feature"
        fix "A bug fix"
        docs "Documentation only changes"
        style "Changes that do not affect the meaning of the code"
        refactor "A code change that neither fixes a bug nor adds a feature"
        test "Adding missing tests or correcting existing tests"
        chore "Changes to the build process or auxiliary tools"
    )
    
    # Select commit type
    print_info "Select commit type:"
    local type
    select type in ${(k)commit_types}; do
        if [[ -n "$type" ]]; then
            break
        fi
    done
    
    # Get commit message
    print_info "Enter commit message:"
    local message
    read -r message
    
    # Optional scope
    print_info "Enter scope (optional, press enter to skip):"
    local scope
    read -r scope
    
    # Build commit message
    local full_message="$type"
    [[ -n "$scope" ]] && full_message+="($scope)"
    full_message+=": $message"
    
    # Show preview
    print_info "Commit message preview:"
    print "  $full_message"
    print_info "Proceed? [y/N]"
    
    local confirm
    read -r confirm
    if [[ "$confirm" =~ ^[Yy]$ ]]; then
        git commit -m "$full_message"
        print_success "Committed successfully"
    else
        print_warning "Commit cancelled"
    fi
}

# Git stash with descriptive names
function git_stash_named() {
    local name="$1"
    if [[ -z "$name" ]]; then
        name="WIP-$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M%S)"
    fi
    
    git stash push -m "$name" && print_success "Stashed as: $name"
}

# Show git log with graph
function git_graph() {
    local count="${1:-20}"
    git log --graph --pretty=format:'%Cred%h%Creset -%C(yellow)%d%Creset %s %Cgreen(%cr) %C(bold blue)<%an>%Creset' --abbrev-commit -n "$count"
}

# Git statistics
function git_stats() {
    print_info "Repository statistics:"
    
    # Total commits
    local total_commits=$(git rev-list --all --count 2>/dev/null)
    print "  Total commits: $total_commits"
    
    # Contributors
    local contributors=$(git shortlog -sn | wc -l | tr -d ' ')
    print "  Contributors: $contributors"
    
    # File count
    local file_count=$(git ls-files | wc -l | tr -d ' ')
    print "  Tracked files: $file_count"
    
    # Repository size
    local repo_size=$(du -sh .git | cut -f1)
    print "  Repository size: $repo_size"
    
    # Most changed files
    print_info "\nMost changed files:"
    git log --pretty=format: --name-only | sort | uniq -c | sort -rg | head -5 | \
        while read count file; do
            [[ -n "$file" ]] && print "  $count changes: $file"
        done
}

print_success "Git module loaded"

#!/usr/bin/env zsh
# Docker helper functions for development environment

# Source utilities if not already loaded
[[ -f "${0:A:h}/../lib/functions.zsh" ]] && source "${0:A:h}/../lib/functions.zsh"

# Docker status overview
function docker_status() {
    if ! command_exists docker; then
        print_error "Docker not found"
        return 1
    fi
    
    # Check if Docker daemon is running
    if ! docker info &>/dev/null; then
        print_error "Docker daemon is not running"
        return 1
    fi
    
    print_info "Docker Status Overview"
    
    # Running containers
    local running=$(docker ps -q | wc -l | tr -d ' ')
    local total=$(docker ps -aq | wc -l | tr -d ' ')
    print "  Containers: %F{green}$running running%f / $total total"
    
    # Images
    local images=$(docker images -q | wc -l | tr -d ' ')
    print "  Images: $images"
    
    # Volumes
    local volumes=$(docker volume ls -q | wc -l | tr -d ' ')
    print "  Volumes: $volumes"
    
    # Networks
    local networks=$(docker network ls -q | wc -l | tr -d ' ')
    print "  Networks: $networks"
    
    # Disk usage
    if command_exists numfmt; then
        local disk_usage=$(docker system df --format json | jq -r '.[0].Size' | numfmt --to=iec)
        print "  Disk usage: $disk_usage"
    fi
}

# Docker compose wrapper with environment detection
function dc() {
    local compose_files=()
    local compose_cmd="docker compose"
    
    # Check for docker-compose files
    [[ -f "docker-compose.yml" ]] && compose_files+=("docker-compose.yml")
    [[ -f "docker-compose.yaml" ]] && compose_files+=("docker-compose.yaml")
    
    # Check for environment-specific files
    local env="${DOCKER_ENV:-development}"
    [[ -f "docker-compose.$env.yml" ]] && compose_files+=("docker-compose.$env.yml")
    [[ -f "docker-compose.$env.yaml" ]] && compose_files+=("docker-compose.$env.yaml")
    
    if (( ${#compose_files} == 0 )); then
        print_error "No docker-compose files found"
        return 1
    fi
    
    # Build command with all compose files
    local cmd="$compose_cmd"
    for file in $compose_files; do
        cmd+=" -f $file"
    done
    
    # Execute with all arguments
    eval "$cmd $@"
}

# Interactive container shell
function docker_shell() {
    local container="$1"
    local shell="${2:-/bin/sh}"
    
    if [[ -z "$container" ]]; then
        # Interactive selection
        if command_exists fzf; then
            container=$(docker ps --format "table {{.Names}}\t{{.Image}}\t{{.Status}}" | \
                tail -n +2 | \
                fzf --height=40% --reverse | \
                awk '{print $1}')
        else
            print_error "Container name required or install fzf for interactive selection"
            return 1
        fi
    fi
    
    if [[ -n "$container" ]]; then
        print_info "Connecting to $container with $shell..."
        docker exec -it "$container" "$shell"
    fi
}

# Docker logs with better formatting
function docker_logs() {
    local container="$1"
    local lines="${2:-100}"
    local follow="${3:-false}"
    
    if [[ -z "$container" ]]; then
        print_error "Usage: docker_logs <container> [lines] [follow]"
        return 1
    fi
    
    local cmd="docker logs --tail $lines"
    [[ "$follow" == "true" ]] && cmd+=" -f"
    cmd+=" $container"
    
    # Add timestamp if supported
    if docker logs --help | grep -q timestamps; then
        cmd+=" --timestamps"
    fi
    
    eval "$cmd"
}

# Clean up Docker resources
function docker_cleanup() {
    print_info "Docker Cleanup Menu:"
    
    local -a options
    options=(
        "1. Remove stopped containers"
        "2. Remove unused images"
        "3. Remove unused volumes"
        "4. Remove unused networks"
        "5. Full system prune (all unused resources)"
        "6. Cancel"
    )
    
    local choice
    select choice in $options; do
        case $REPLY in
            1)
                print_info "Removing stopped containers..."
                docker container prune -f
                print_success "Stopped containers removed"
                ;;
            2)
                print_info "Removing unused images..."
                docker image prune -f
                print_success "Unused images removed"
                ;;
            3)
                print_info "Removing unused volumes..."
                docker volume prune -f
                print_success "Unused volumes removed"
                ;;
            4)
                print_info "Removing unused networks..."
                docker network prune -f
                print_success "Unused networks removed"
                ;;
            5)
                print_warning "This will remove all unused Docker resources!"
                print "Continue? [y/N]"
                local confirm
                read -r confirm
                if [[ "$confirm" =~ ^[Yy]$ ]]; then
                    docker system prune -af --volumes
                    print_success "System cleanup completed"
                fi
                ;;
            6)
                print_info "Cleanup cancelled"
                ;;
        esac
        break
    done
}

# Build and tag Docker image with smart defaults
function docker_build() {
    local dockerfile="${1:-Dockerfile}"
    local tag="${2:-}"
    
    if [[ ! -f "$dockerfile" ]]; then
        print_error "Dockerfile not found: $dockerfile"
        return 1
    fi
    
    # Auto-generate tag if not provided
    if [[ -z "$tag" ]]; then
        local project=$(basename "$PWD" | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]')
        local branch=$(git branch --show-current 2>/dev/null || echo "latest")
        tag="$project:$branch"
    fi
    
    print_info "Building Docker image: $tag"
    print_info "Using Dockerfile: $dockerfile"
    
    # Build with BuildKit
    DOCKER_BUILDKIT=1 docker build -f "$dockerfile" -t "$tag" . && \
        print_success "Successfully built: $tag"
}

# Docker compose environment manager
function docker_env() {
    local action="$1"
    local env="$2"
    
    case "$action" in
        set)
            if [[ -z "$env" ]]; then
                print_error "Usage: docker_env set <environment>"
                return 1
            fi
            export DOCKER_ENV="$env"
            print_success "Docker environment set to: $env"
            ;;
        get)
            print_info "Current Docker environment: ${DOCKER_ENV:-development}"
            ;;
        list)
            print_info "Available environments:"
            for file in docker-compose.*.y{a,}ml(N); do
                local env_name=${file:t:r:e}
                [[ "$env_name" != "override" ]] && print "  - $env_name"
            done
            ;;
        *)
            print_error "Usage: docker_env {set|get|list} [environment]"
            return 1
            ;;
    esac
}

# Docker stats with better formatting
function docker_stats() {
    local format="table {{.Container}}\t{{.CPUPerc}}\t{{.MemUsage}}\t{{.NetIO}}\t{{.BlockIO}}"
    
    if [[ "$1" == "--no-stream" ]]; then
        docker stats --no-stream --format "$format"
    else
        print_info "Press Ctrl+C to exit..."
        docker stats --format "$format"
    fi
}

print_success "Docker module loaded"

#!/usr/bin/env zsh
# Development Environment Manager - Main Script

print "=== ZSH DEVELOPMENT ENVIRONMENT MANAGER ==="
print ""

# Get script directory
SCRIPT_DIR="${0:A:h}"

# Source all libraries and modules
print "Loading libraries..."
source "$SCRIPT_DIR/lib/functions.zsh"
source "$SCRIPT_DIR/lib/completions.zsh"

print "\nLoading modules..."
source "$SCRIPT_DIR/modules/git.zsh"
source "$SCRIPT_DIR/modules/docker.zsh"

print ""
print "=== DEMONSTRATING ZSH FEATURES ==="

# 1. Associative Arrays
print "\n1. Associative Arrays:"
typeset -A project_info
project_info=(
    name "devenv-manager"
    version "1.0.0"
    author "ZSH Developer"
    language "zsh"
)

for key val in ${(kv)project_info}; do
    print "   $key: $val"
done

# 2. Parameter Expansion
print "\n2. Parameter Expansion:"
local test_path="/home/user/projects/my-app/src/index.js"
print "   Full path: $test_path"
print "   Directory: ${test_path:h}"
print "   Filename: ${test_path:t}"
print "   Extension: ${test_path:e}"
print "   Without extension: ${test_path:r}"

# 3. Glob Qualifiers
print "\n3. Glob Qualifiers (simulated):"
print "   Would find: *.zsh files modified in last 7 days"
print "   Command: **/*.zsh(.mM-7)"
print "   Would find: Directories only"
print "   Command: *(/)"

# 4. Arrays and Array Operations
print "\n4. Arrays and Operations:"
local -a languages=(python javascript ruby go rust)
print "   Languages: ${(j:, :)languages}"
print "   First: ${languages[1]}"
print "   Last: ${languages[-1]}"
print "   Count: ${#languages}"
print "   Reversed: ${(Oa)languages}"

# 5. Arithmetic and Floating Point
print "\n5. Arithmetic Operations:"
local -i num1=42
local -i num2=7
print "   Integer math: $num1 / $num2 = $((num1 / num2))"
print "   Floating point: $num1 / $num2 = $((num1 / 7.0))"

# 6. Command Substitution with Arrays
print "\n6. Command Substitution:"
local -a shell_files
shell_files=($(find . -name "*.zsh" -type f 2>/dev/null | head -5))
if (( ${#shell_files} > 0 )); then
    print "   Found ${#shell_files} .zsh files:"
    for file in $shell_files; do
        print "     - ${file:t}"
    done
else
    print "   No .zsh files found in current directory"
fi

print ""
print "=== TESTING UTILITY FUNCTIONS ==="

# Test color output
print "\nTesting color output functions:"
print_info "This is an info message"
print_success "This is a success message"
print_warning "This is a warning message"
print_error "This is an error message"

# Test command existence
print "\nChecking commands:"
for cmd in git docker python zsh bash; do
    if command_exists "$cmd"; then
        print_success "$cmd is installed"
    else
        print_error "$cmd is not installed"
    fi
done

# Test duration formatting
print "\nTesting duration formatting:"
for seconds in 45 125 3665 86420; do
    print "   $seconds seconds = $(format_duration $seconds)"
done

print ""
print "=== TESTING GIT FUNCTIONS ==="

# Test git status (will show error if not in git repo)
print "\nTesting git_status:"
git_status

# Show git stats if in a git repo
if git rev-parse --git-dir &>/dev/null; then
    print "\nTesting git_stats:"
    git_stats
fi

print ""
print "=== TESTING DOCKER FUNCTIONS ==="

# Test docker status
print "\nTesting docker_status:"
docker_status

# Show docker environment
print "\nTesting docker_env:"
docker_env get
docker_env list

print ""
print "=== INTERACTIVE FEATURES ==="
print ""
print "This environment manager provides:"
print "  ‚Ä¢ Tab completion for all commands (source this in your .zshrc)"
print "  ‚Ä¢ Interactive git branch switching (requires fzf)"
print "  ‚Ä¢ Interactive docker container selection"
print "  ‚Ä¢ Conventional commit message helper"
print "  ‚Ä¢ Docker compose multi-environment support"

print ""
print "=== ZSH-SPECIFIC FEATURES DEMONSTRATED ==="
print ""
print "‚úì Associative arrays (typeset -A)"
print "‚úì Advanced parameter expansion"
print "‚úì Glob qualifiers (file selection)"
print "‚úì Array operations and joining"
print "‚úì Arithmetic and floating-point math"
print "‚úì Command substitution into arrays"
print "‚úì Function autoloading"
print "‚úì Custom completions"
print "‚úì Print formatting with -P flag"
print "‚úì Prompt expansion for colors"

print ""
print "=== SESSION INFORMATION ==="
print ""
print "All files created in this session:"
for file in lib/functions.zsh lib/completions.zsh modules/git.zsh modules/docker.zsh main.zsh; do
    if [[ -f "$file" ]]; then
        print_success "$file"
    fi
done

print ""
print "‚úÖ Multi-file ZSH application demo completed!"
print ""
print "To use this in your environment:"
print "  1. Source main.zsh in your .zshrc"
print "  2. Use 'devenv' command with tab completion"
print "  3. Access git_* and docker_* functions directly"
print ""
print "üîÑ All files persist within this container session"
print "üóëÔ∏è  Files will be cleaned up when container restarts"
print "üîí Host system remains completely isolated"
